Posts.Content: SUEJEHL wrote: My doctor prescribed Chlarithromycin to reduce chance of building up resistence to Letrozole.  Not sure how an antibiotic works to reduce resistence.  Anyone else done this?  Not thrilled with taking antibiotics. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biaxin (Chlarithromycin) Anyone else taking this and ER/PR+++? SUEJEHL Bestbird

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2013 03:41PM - edited Feb 27, 2013 03:46PM by SUEJEHL Hi, I was diagnosed Stage IV three years ago at age 36.  Estrogen positive with Bone and Liver Mets. Had an oopherectomy after diagnosis. Had an ovarian remnant left over from surgery but lupron put me into menopause.  Now on Letrozole, Zometa and Lupron. Hope you are doing well.  It is a crazy ride but there are tons of options out there combined with nutrition and exercise.  Met a women last year who was diagnosed with bone mets 30 years ago!
Posts.Title: Stage IV - Estrogen positive - Bone Mets... Eva_V kebab
